body: $PKKFF And to everyone who is afraid of the reverse split: don't be! In this case its a positive catalyst. Assuming that the SP upon uplist won't be $5
created_at: they will be doing it so that big institutions (who can't invest in companies with a SP under $5) can get in upon uplist. It will also tighten the float of the stock. Once institutions will be fighting for shares on Nasdaq

body: $PKKFF Made an account just for Peak (soon to be renamed to Tenet
created_at: ticker $TNT). Holding since 2018. The company has so many short-term catalysts coming. A.o.: (a) approval of Nasdaq uplist
column7: (e) expansion to North America. Wouldn't surprise me if the SP is at $40 mid summer. They should do like $200m revenues this year and $500m revenues next year
column8: not taking into account any new deals and the expansion to North America
column9: and will likely be profitable this year. Simply compare the multiples given to similar fintech companies in the US
column11: to Peak (1x 2021 revenues) and it is evident that Peak is MASSIVELY undervalued. Looking forward to the ride this year. Hopefully conservative 2021 revenue guidance that will be beat each quarter resulting in massive upswings of the SP. What an opportunity to get in at ground level.

id: He replied within minutes saying:  â€œIn terms of the offering
body: I can't speak in specific terms about the delay.  I know the company has a history of being on time with their announced deadlines.  In general for offerings there are always legal and regulatory items that need to addressed
